Description: Vase made of straw-tempered Nile silt pottery with round body and base, short neck and everted roll-rim, coated with red slip and burnished.
Curator's comments: For excavations see E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911). Type most like Polished red P85f in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
